## incremental builds

a fundamental problem of nix are the long build times

when a complex build fails, you have to rebuild from scratch, and you cannot share compilation results between builds

if you have lots of money (and a cheap energy source), you "just buy a faster computer" and/or "just buy more computers"... but for low budget (and in a [future of high energy costs](http://collapseos.org/why.html)), that wont work

incremental builds are more aggressive than granular caching, because granular caching can give a cache miss, when some \*unused\* input was changed (when using outPath as cache key). incremental builds would consider only \*used\* inputs to generate the cache key

Right now wine packaging is basically a hack because wine doesn't like immutability. A proper way IMO would be to implement some kind of dotd migration of the registry database and overlay the prefix data so the default stuff is not just copied over. Right now I still use my workaround for 7zip because I prefer the windows gui and it runs well and for games and stuff I just use proton.

1. Creating a Wine prefix in the Nix store is nearly impossible because Wine is a highly-stateful application. It uses all kinds of data about it's runtime environmnent, making it very difficult to build a Wine prefix in a reproduceable way.
2. I looked into deduplication of the Wine prefix against the Wine package in the Nix store, but it didn't work because the dedup tools (fdupes, jdupes, duperemove) don't deduplicate across directory trees; They only deduplicate _within_ a directory tree. It may be possible to overcome this limitation by creating a temporary directory which then contains symlinks to the appropriate path in the Nix store and also the Wine prefix, and then deduplication the temporary directory.
3. `mkWindowsApp` already makes use of layered filesystems (implemented with unionfs) to save on disk space; It's the reason I went through the head-scratching effort. But it only comes into play when using multiple applications with the same version of Wine. For example, if you have two apps which use Wine64-full, then they would both share the same base Wine64-full Wine prefix.
4. There's an effort to add support for reflink copying of files to Wine. It would only work on filesystems which support COW, such as BTRFS and XFS (my recommendation), and only when the Nix store and $HOME directories are on the same filesystem. But having reflink support in Wine would be amazing! Not only would it save on disk space, it should also make Wine prefix creation much faster since less data would need to be copied.  I don't know the status of this effort.

basically there are 2 cases

- stateless apps: no config, no cache
- stateful apps

### stateless apps

stateless apps are simple command line tools like [qaac](https://github.com/milahu/nur-packages/tree/master/pkgs/applications/audio/qaac) or [nmake](https://github.com/milahu/microsoft-nmake)
these should work with a read-only `$WINEPREFIX` in `/nix/store`
and store nothing in `$HOME`

to make this work without recompiling wine
im currently messing with dynamic binary patching of wine

in the wine source, this looks like

```c
// server/request.c
    if (st->st_uid != getuid()) fatal_error( "%s is not owned by you\n", name );

// server/request.c
    if (st.st_uid != getuid())
        fatal_error( "%s is not owned by you\n", config_dir );

// dlls/ntdll/unix/server.c
    if (st.st_uid != getuid()) fatal_error( "'%s' is not owned by you\n", config_dir );

// dlls/ntdll/unix/server.c
    if (st.st_uid != getuid()) fatal_error( "'%s' is not owned by you\n", server_dir );
```

in this pseudo-assembly code i want to replace `jne` with `nop`

```
set $eax "WINEPREFIX"
call getenv ; -> $eax = "/path/to/wineprefix"
call stat ; -> $eax = struct stat { ... }
set $ebx result_of_stat

call getuid ; -> $eax = 1000
cmp $eax,($ebx + stat_uid_offset)
jne call_fatal_error ; conditional jump to call_fatal_error

; call_fatal_error exits wine with
; "%s is not owned by you\n" or
; "'%s' is not owned by you\n"
```

with static binary patching of `/nix/store/fa1fn9p561cy7nlzvdgmkgzpy20fxcm5-wine-9.0`
this looks like

```
sed -i 's/\x39\xc6\x0f\x85\x47\x04\x00\x00/\x39\xc6\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90/' lib/wine/i386-unix/ntdll.so
sed -i 's/\x39\xc6\x0f\x85\x8b\x06\x00\x00/\x39\xc6\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90/' lib/wine/i386-unix/ntdll.so
sed -i 's/\x39\xc5\x0f\x85\x9f\x00\x00\x00/\x39\xc5\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90/' bin/wineserver
sed -i 's/\x39\xc7\x0f\x85\x34\x03\x00\x00/\x39\xc7\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90\x90/' bin/wineserver
#         cmp     jne.....call_fatal_error cmp     6x nop
```

the challenge here is to find
a dynamic way to find the `jne call_fatal_error` instructions

the error can be triggered by
`WINEPREFIX=/var/empty wine cmd.exe` or
`WINEPREFIX=/var/empty wineboot --init`
because `/var/empty` is owned by root

so now i only have to trace all instructions leading to `fatal_error`
which is harder than expected... but im getting there
either with `gdb` or `lldb`

### stateful apps

stateful apps need to store config and cache in `$HOME`
so we need a way to merge a read-only wineprefix in `/nix/store`
with a writable `$WINEPREFIX` in `$HOME`

ideally this merging of wineprefixes should also work on ext4 without cow
which leaves us with symlinks

also, no cleanup code should be required to commit changes to `$HOME`
because that means data loss on `kill -9`

`$WINEPREFIX` is created by `wineboot --init`
so we will have to wrap or patch `wineboot`

one challenge here is to identify a minimal list of writable files
the app install would run in `installPhase`

stdenvNoCC.mkDerivation {

    unzip

    wine

    #wmctrl
    openbox

    _get_screenshot() {
      #import -window root -crop $crop -colorspace Gray $1
      import -window root -colorspace Gray $1
    }

    _capture_hash() {
      _get_screenshot screenshot.png
      if [ -e screenshot.png ]; then
        h=$(md5sum screenshot.png | cut -c1-32)
        echo "$h"
        rm screenshot.png
      fi
    }

    _window_name() {
      local i=$(xdotool getactivewindow 2>/dev/null || true)
      [ -z "$i" ] && return
      local n=$(xdotool getwindowname $i 2>/dev/null || true)
      [ -z "$n" ] && return
      echo "$i: $n"
    }

    _sleep() {
      local t=0
      local c=0
      local a
      local o
      for a in "$@"; do case "$a" in
        -c) c=1;;
        *) t="$a";;
      esac; done
      if [ "$t" = 0 ]; then echo "_sleep: error: time argument is missing"; return 1; fi
      for ((k=0;k<$t;k++)); do
        #_list_windows # debug
        c=0; screenshot_hash_prev= # dont wait for change
        _get_screenshot screenshot.png
        if [ -e screenshot.png ]; then
          h=$(md5sum screenshot.png | cut -c1-32)
          if [ "$h" != "$screenshot_hash_prev" ]; then
            o=screenshot.$(printf "%03d" $screenshot_id).png
            mv screenshot.png $o
            echo "done $o $h @ $(_window_name)"
            screenshot_hash_prev="$h"
            [ $c = 1 ] && break # wait for change
          else
            rm screenshot.png
          fi
        fi
        : $((screenshot_id++))
        sleep 1
      done
    }

    _list_windows() {
      local id
      local name
      echo "windows:"
      for id in $(xdotool search --name '.+'); do
        name=$(xdotool getwindowname $id 2>/dev/null || true)
        [ -z "$name" ] && continue
        echo "  $id: $name"
      done
    }

    _wait_for_window() {
      echo "_wait_for_window: waiting for window: ''${1@Q}"
      local n
      local i
      for ((i=0;i<60;i++)); do
        n=$(xdotool getactivewindow getwindowname 2>/dev/null || true)
        if [ "$n" = "$1" ]; then
          return 0
        fi
        _sleep 1
      done
      echo "_wait_for_window: error: timeout"
      return 1
    }

    _wait_for_empty_desktop() {
      _wait_for_window ""
    }

    ###

    for zip in *.zip; do
      unzip -o "$zip"
    done
    rm *.zip

    unrar x IDAPr68.rar
    #7z x IDAPr68.rar # error: Can't open as archive
    rm IDAPr68.r??

    export HOME=$out/home
    mkdir -p $HOME

    #set -x

    export WINEPREFIX="$HOME/wine"

    # disable wine error messages by default
    #export WINEDEBUG="${WINEDEBUG:=-all}"
    export WINEDEBUG='-all'

    # Initialize the WINEPREFIX.
    # the wine configuration is being updated, please wait...
    # FIXME wrap wineboot, symlink files from nix store
    wineboot --init

    export DISPLAY=:2

    Xvnc -SecurityTypes None -geometry 800x600 -depth 16 -localhost -ZlibLevel 0 -Log '*:stderr:0' $DISPLAY &
    xvnc_pid=$!

    echo 'waiting for Xvnc'
    sleep 3

    # start window manager
    # needed to switch between windows: ida installer, python installer
    openbox &
    echo 'waiting for openbox'
    sleep 2

    screenshot_hash_empty=$(_capture_hash)
    screenshot_hash_prev=
    screenshot_id=0

    echo "empy desktop screenshot hash: $screenshot_hash_empty"

    echo 'starting: install ida'
    wine idapronw_hexarmw_hexx64w_hexx86w_150413_cb5d8b3937caf856aaae750455d2b4ae.exe &
    wine_pid=$!

    echo 'waiting for dialog: install ida'
    _wait_for_window "Setup - IDA Pro v6.8 and Hex-Rays Decompiler (ARM,x64,x86)"
    ida_window=$(xdotool getactivewindow)
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    # TODO check if $wine_pid is still running

    echo 'waiting for input: accept license'
    _sleep -c 2
    xdotool key Tab # focus yes/no buttons
    sleep 1
    xdotool key Up
    sleep 1
    xdotool key space
    sleep 1
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for input: install python'
    _sleep -c 2
    # leave enabled: "install python 2.7"
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for input: enter password'
    _sleep -c 2
    xdotool type $(cat install_pass.txt) # enter password
    sleep 1
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for input: install path'
    _sleep -c 2
    # leave install path: "C:\Program Files\IDA 6.8"
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for input: create desktop icon'
    _sleep -c 2
    # leave disabled: "create desktop icon"
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for input: install button'
    _sleep -c 2
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for ida install'
    _sleep -c 30 # TODO dynamic: wait for active window name

    echo 'waiting for dialog: python 2.7.6 setup'
    _wait_for_window "Python 2.7.6 Setup"
    # leave option: install for all users
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 
    # ida installer returns for 5 seconds

    echo 'waiting for input: python install path'
    _sleep -c 10 # TODO dynamic: wait for active window name
    # leave install path: "C:\Python27\"
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for input: customize python'
    _sleep -c 2
    # leave settings: "customize python"
    xdotool key Enter # click "next" 

    echo 'waiting for python install'
    _sleep -c 30 # wait for install # TODO dynamic
    xdotool key Enter # click "finish" 

    # FIXME switch to window: setup ida pro
    #xdotool getactivewindow
    xdotool windowfocus $ida_window

    echo 'waiting for input: launch IDA'
    _sleep -c 2
    xdotool key space

    echo 'waiting for finish'
    _sleep -c 2
    xdotool key Enter # click "finish" 

    _sleep -c 1
    # TODO assert empty desktop
    echo "TODO assert empty desktop: $(_capture_hash) versus $screenshot_hash_empty"

    echo 'waiting for install'
    _wait_for_empty_desktop
    #_sleep -c 5 # wait for wine, xvnc
    _sleep 1

    kill $wine_pid || true
    echo 'waiting for Xvnc'
    _sleep 1

    kill $xvnc_pid || true
  '';

  /*
    # debug
    #mv screenshot.*.png $out; exit 0

    # debug
    echo ls $HOME/'.wine/drive_c/Program Files/IDA 6.8/'
    ls $HOME/'.wine/drive_c/Program Files/IDA 6.8/'

    # TODO create wrapper
    # wine $HOME/'.wine/drive_c/Program Files/IDA 6.8/idaq64.exe'
  */

}
